jx.jx_en_mean: be at the very end of a line of people
(of a person) show anger or irritation; go on the attack

lj.lj_ly: the press reared up in the wake of the bombings.
lj.lj_ls: 飞机轰炸之后新闻界又折腾了一番。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (first used as a military term): from Old French rere, based on Latin retro 'back'
Old English ræran 'set upright, construct, elevate', of Germanic origin; related to raise (which has supplanted rear in many applications), also to rise

entry.tran: （建筑物或车辆的）后部，后面，背面
entry.def: The rear of something such as a building or vehicle is the back part of it.

example.ex: He settled back in the rear of the taxi.
example.tran: 他靠坐在出租车的后排座上。

example.ex: ...a stairway in the rear of the building.

entry.def: If you are at the rear of a moving line of people, you are the last person in it.

example.ex: Musicians played at the front and rear of the procession...
example.tran: 乐师们在队前和队尾表演。

example.ex: The Lord Mayor follows at the rear in his gilded coach.
example.tran: 市长大人坐在他阔气的马车里在后面跟着。

entry.def: Your rear is the part of your body that you sit on.

example.ex: I turned away from the phone to see Lewis pat a waitress on her rear.
example.tran: 我打完电话后转过头，看见刘易斯拍了拍一个女招待的屁股。

entry.def: If you rear children, you look after them until they are old enough to look after themselves.

example.ex: She reared sixteen children, six her own and ten her husband's...
example.tran: 她养大了16个孩子，其中6个是她亲生的，10个是她丈夫带来的。

example.ex: I was reared in east Texas.
example.tran: 我在得克萨斯州东部长大。

entry.def: If you rear a young animal, you keep and look after it until it is old enough to be used for work or food, or until it can look after itself.

example.ex: She spends a lot of time rearing animals.
example.tran: 她花费大量时间饲养动物。

entry.def: When a horse rears, it moves the front part of its body upwards, so that its front legs are high in the air and it is standing on its back legs.

example.ex: The horse reared and threw off its rider.
example.tran: 那匹马前蹄腾空向后仰，把骑手摔了下去。

entry.def: If you say that something such as a building or mountain rears above you, you mean that is very tall and close to you.

example.ex: The exhibition hall reared above me behind a high fence...
example.tran: 高高的围墙后面，展览大厅耸立在我面前。

example.ex: The mountains reared up on each side, steep and white.
example.tran: 两边的山峦高耸入云，山势陡峭，覆盖着积雪。

entry.def: If a person or vehicle is bringing up the rear, they are the last person or vehicle in a moving line of them.

example.ex: ...police motorcyclists bringing up the rear of the procession.
example.tran: 摩托骑警行进在队伍最后

entry.tran: （令人不快之物）显现，露头，显露
entry.def: If something unpleasant rears its head or rears its ugly head, it becomes visible or noticeable.

example.ex: The threat of strikes reared its head again this summer...
example.tran: 今年夏天又显现出了罢工的势头。

example.ex: The extreme right reared its ugly head in the 1980s.
example.tran: 极右势力在20世纪80年代有所抬头。

means.word_mean: 1. the back of a military formation or procession;
2. the side of an object that is opposite its front;

sentences.sentence: "his room was toward the rear of the hotel"

means.word_mean: 3. the part of something that is furthest from the normal viewer;

sentences.sentence: "he stood at the back of the stage"
"it was hidden in the rear of the store"

means.word_mean: 4. the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on;

sentences.sentence: "he deserves a good kick in the butt"
"are you going to sit on your fanny and do nothing?"

means.word_mean: 5. the side that goes last or is not normally seen;

sentences.sentence: "he wrote the date on the back of the photograph"

means.word_mean: 1. stand up on the hind legs, of quadrupeds;
1. located in or toward the back or rear;

Sentence.sentence: Early models often failed to withstand crashes, however, so in 1965 the device was completely redesigned and moved to the rear of the plane – the area least subject to impact – from its original position in the landing wells (起落架舱).
consciousness raising, and non-sexist child rearing would close the gender divide once and for all.
In Japan young women may be rebelling against their mothers' isolated lives of child rearing.
They cannot afford the time and expenses of rearing children

sentences.en: He rears all kinds of birds.
The hall is in the rear of the building.
We attacked the enemy in the rear.
sentences.cn: 我们从敌人的背后袭击。

sentences.en: He got kicked in the rear.

jushi.english: The horse reared at the sight of the fire engine.
jushi.chinese: 看见救火车,马突然后腿站立。
